page.title: 08Burghley Park
page.content: In the 1700's the walled parkland around Burghley House was laid out by Launcelot (Capability) Brown. A wide variety of trees inculde a recently replaced Lime Tree Avenue,Sweet - Chesnut,Californian Red Wood and a Corsican Pine, planted by the lake in 1897 to celebrate Queen Victoria's Jubilee. Many elms have died from Dutch Elm disease.The Red Cross benefits from the fishing rights.There are an unusual number of fresh water- mussels.Golden carp swim in the pond. Activites in the parkland include The Burghley Horse Trials,Caravan and Steam Engine Rallies,Police Dog Trials ,Cricket and Cross Country Running.Of a captive herd of 200 fallow deer,20% are culled annually.Another wild herd wanders between Stamford and Castor Hanglands with a small herd of Muntjac deer which escaped from Woburn Estate.
